content:
Hi Guys, it would be great if people attending the connectathon put their contact details in conMan (CONnectathon MANager btw). It should be simple:

1. Navigate to http://conman.fhir.org/connectathon.html?event=baltimore2018
2. At the login screen, click the 'Register new person' link, and enter your name there, then login to the app. No password is needed.
3. Find yourself in the 'peoples' tab (there's a filter box above the list to make it easy) then edit your entry to add contact details - especially your primary track and tracks of interest.

You only need to do this once - the login details are cached in the browser cache (If you use a different browser, then you'll be able to select your name from the list - you don't need to register again).

If you are hosting a server, then enter the details on the server tab (appears when any track is selected). Remember to click the 'Check CapabilityStatement' link to load the capabilityStatement which sets the FHIR version (and also shows the 'Server Capability tab'

If you want to view the capabilities of an existing server, then select the 'view' link in the list and click the 'Check CapabilityStatement' link again (the CapabilityStatements are not saved in the database as they get large so need to be loaded each time)

To see who in interested/participation in each track, use the 'Participation Report' tab.

If there are any issues - use this chat. See you in Baltimore!
Hi Guys - I've stood up a conman instance at http://conman.fhir.org/connectathon.html?event=sanant2019 for those tracks using it...
Thanks @David Hay, linked!

A reminder to track leads that the conman connectathon tool is available at http://conman.clinfhir.com/connectathon.html?event=montreal2019

If you're going to use this to track participation in your stream then be sure to create an entry for your track ahead of the event (I note a number of you already have) so that users can indicate their participation and register their servers and clients. Should be pretty straight forward (and remember that these will all be 'technical' tracks), but feel free to reach out for help - either through the chat or directly to me - david.hay25 at gmail.com
The link on the connectathon page still points to conman in Montreal. @David Hay do we have a new link? My guess on the event code failed :)
Apologies Jenni - thanks for reminding me - all set up now! (and I bet your guess was correct :) )
Thanks! And yup, see it now :)
@David Hay is there a version of ConMan available for the Atlanta Connectathon (#22)?
http://conman.clinfhir.com/connectathon.html?event=atlanta2019
@David Hay what happened to the servers tab? I'm not seeing it anymore
@Jenni Syed , I found it reappeared once I clicked on a specific track.
Fun :)
thanks!
which track? It needs to be of type 'technical' to show...
This is just the broad server tab that crosses tracks. Was expecting it to always show
What is the prescribed way to add a server to a specific track? I haven't found anything other than "EndPoint"
But then I have to re-document what I already added to the generic servers list

The tab only shows when a technical track is selected (I'm going to remove non-technical tracks after the event so it will always appear then.
To add a server to a track, select the track, then the 'technical testing tab. You'll see all the scenarios for that track in a list across the page. To the right of each scenario is an 'add server link that allows you to add a server to that scenario in a given role (which is defined in the scenario). After this, the track/role will appear alongside the server in the servers tab.

There's a client link to the left that does the same for clients.

User Interface (and functionality) suggestions always welcomed!

BTW - planning on re-naming conman to 'Event Manager' - apparently my sense of humour is very Kiwi specific (or, maybe, not even that :) ). I'm also going to pull out the Graph Building part (used for the clinician event) into a separate app, making conman / event manager a technical connectathon app only. Will help to simplify the UI hopefully...
Does anyone here know what the conman event code for the CMS Connectathon in Baltimore Jan, 2020 is / will be?
haven't set it up yet! Will make it sydney2020 and ping when done...
(Note @David Hay you probably want "Baltimore 2020" for this one :-))
oops - sorry, yes!
... and done! http://conman.clinfhir.com/connectathon.html?event=sydney2020 and http://conman.clinfhir.com/connectathon.html?event=baltimore2020
The Conman link on https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2020-05+Connectathon+24 is dead. Are we using it this time? If so, what's the correct link?
Is it dead because it points you to a login or is it just not coming up for you?
I'm seeing this content when logged in: image.png
oh wait, i see, the conman link
Sorry - haven't set up a conman instance yet - will do so today and ping this chat...

Should all be running at http://conman.clinfhir.com/connectathon.html?event=hl7online

let me know if there are any issues...

BTW - if you are having any issues with conman then be sure to '@ include' me and I'll resolve as fast as possible (though I am in NZ timezone). I suspect the chat traffic will be heavy this connectathon!
Good guess.

Conman instance at http://conman.clinfhir.com/connectathon.html?event=con25

Note that there's an issue using the brave browser - related to cookies I think that I haven't had a chance to debug, so that browser won't work... (at least at the moment)...
and just for @Josh Mandel - I promise to work on SSL for next time :)
Brave is currently my default on Android ;-)
I'd better put in the effort then! I use Brave myself, but wasn't sure how widespread its use was ...

@David Hay do we need to add the Terminology Services Track to ConMan in order for you to be able to import the TS scenarios from the previous Connectathon (#24) or can you import an entire Track? @Rob Hausam it would be good to have all this set up by/at the weekend so we don't run out of time due to client commitments!
Yes, agree, Peter.
No worries! I'll do that in the next day or so & ping you when done...
all done!
Wonderful, many thanks @David Hay . All ready for you to add yourself and more details (e.g. Track Lead) @Rob Hausam
@Peter Jordan Done.

Have set up conman for connectathon 26 for those who use it
@Peter Jordan have copied across the terminology track for you...

BTW - There is an issue using the Brave browser that I have yet to track down - chrome works fine tho...
